page.title: 01Location
page.content: Fir Ends School is situated in the village of Smithfield which is in the North East of the County of Cumbria about 8 miles from Carlisle,6 miles from Brampton and 5 miles from Longtown. The main road running through the village is the A6071 from Brampton in the East to Gretna in the West. At Brampton this road joins the A69 which is the main Trunk road from Carlisle to Newcastle upon Tyne and at Gretna it joins with the A 74 and A75. The A74 leads to Glasgow and the A75 to Stranraer in Scotland where one can take the ferry to Larne in Northern Ireland.In Longtown the A6071 also joins the A7 which is one of the major routes to Edinburgh.
